properties.name: Austin Books
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedBest Comic Book Store ever! I\'m there every Wednesday (or Thursdays after a Monday Holiday). Come see me and I\'ll give you a free recommendation.

properties.name: Blue House
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedAlong with Subash, Phil, and Grant, I lived in this dilapidated blue house during my last full semester in school (Fall 2005). It was pretty great, and the walk to campus was gorgeous. Negatives: toilet, general state of the bathroom, toilet, toilet, toilet. Positives: roommates, proximity to Speedway food mart and hooka bar, skateboarding, not walking up stairs, diagonal bed, hanging out at night.

properties.name: Comida Mexicana
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedRobbie and I like to eat here. It has all the freshness of interior mexican, with the familiar picks of Tex-Mex. I give it 7 stars (out of 4).

properties.name: Cozy Rusted Bridge
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedOn the way to school or work, or if you have to come by here, it\'s best to cross the creek with the help of this \'petit pont\'. It doesn\'t look like much, and that\'s the best part. It doesn\'t ask for much, just a visitor from time to time.

properties.name: Eat-In Sonic
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedWhen I was nine years old I took a 2 month trip with my grandparents. The day before I left, my mom and I spent the entire day together, just doing fun things and such. This was the place I picked to eat. We walked in, sat down at the booth, picked up an old phone, and called "in" our order from where we were sitting. It was really really awesome and I still love the idea of Eat-In Sonics. That day, I also read "The Death of Superman" for the first time.

properties.name: Flat tire on the Saturn
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedI blew out a tire one night coming home from work. It was a little after midnight, and as I was looking in the trunk for the spare tire, I felt some headlights behind me. I looked back and saw a car pulling up; it turns out it was just an older woman that wanted to make sure people driving past saw me on the side of the road, so she was just idling with her lights on.

properties.name: Great coffee place
properties.description: Posted by Clayreed Phil introduced me to this treasure, and I\'ve been going ever since. It\'s a good place to study, the English Breakfast tea is amazing, and the chairs are just uncomfortable enough to make you concentrate on your studies - a real winner.

properties.name: Monday Night Soccer
properties.description: Posted by Clayreed Following the frenzy of the World Cup, we started playing here every Monday night. They\'re redoing the grass now, but once the pitch is up and running again, so will we.

properties.name: Moore Hill - First Dorm
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedThis was the first dorm I ever lived in - it was the first place I ever lived w/o the parents. Moving in was fun, and 5 months later I got a new roommate, Andy, who turned out to be awesome.

properties.name: Robbin's Place Apt's
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedI lived here for a year (2004-05) with Phil and Kassi. It was awesome, but overpriced, and I painted cave drawings on my bedroom wall and had to cover it when I moved out. Best things about the place: X-Men Legends, McDonald\'s Buckets of Nuggets, and Pre Downtown Hanging Out

properties.name: Springhill Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Clayreed I worked here during high school. It was greasy and great.

properties.name: The Library
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedOn Thursday nights, we\'d often leave our free beers at our cozy, relatively quiet places and meet here, at a place that is pretty expensive, and so loud that you can\'t here your friend next to you.

properties.name: Work
properties.description: Posted by ClayreedI work around these parts.
